```javascriptreact
import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'

function App() {
  const [city, setCity] = useState('')
  const [weather, setWeather] = useState(null)
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false)
  const [error, setError] = useState('')

  const fetchWeather = async (cityName) => {
    if (!cityName.trim()) return
    
    setLoading(true)
    setError('')
    
    try {
      // First, get coordinates for the city
      const geocodingResponse = await fetch(
        `https://geocoding-api.open-meteo.com/v1/search?name=${encodeURIComponent(cityName)}&count=1&language=en&format=json`
      )
      const geocodingData = await geocodingResponse.json()
      
      if (!geocodingData.results || geocodingData.results.length === 0) {
        throw new Error('City not found')
      }
      
      const { latitude, longitude, name, country } = geocodingData.results[0]
      
      // Then, get weather data
      const weatherResponse = await fetch(
        `https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast?latitude=${latitude}&longitude=${longitude}&current=temperature_2m,relative_humidity_2m,apparent_temperature,precipitation,weather_code,wind_speed_10m,wind_direction_10m&timezone=auto`
      )
      const weatherData = await weatherResponse.json()
      
      if (weatherData.error) {
        throw new Error(weatherData.reason || 'Failed to fetch weather data')
      }
      
      setWeather({
        ...weatherData.current,
        location: { name, country, latitude, longitude }
      })
    } catch (err) {
      setError(err.message)
      setWeather(null)
    } finally {
      setLoading(false)
    }
  }

  const handleSubmit = (e) => {
    e.preventDefault()
    fetchWeather(city)
  }

  const getWeatherIcon = (weatherCode) => {
    const icons = {
      0: '☀️', // Clear sky
      1: '🌤️', // Mainly clear
      2: '⛅', // Partly cloudy
      3: '☁️', // Overcast
      45: '🌫️', // Fog
      48: '🌫️', // Depositing rime fog
      51: '🌦️', // Light drizzle
      53: '🌦️', // Moderate drizzle
      55: '🌦️', // Dense drizzle
      61: '🌧️', // Slight rain
      63: '🌧️', // Moderate rain
      65: '🌧️', // Heavy rain
      71: '❄️', // Slight snow
      73: '❄️', // Moderate snow
      75: '❄️', // Heavy snow
      77: '❄️', // Snow grains
      80: '🌦️', // Slight rain showers
      81: '🌦️', // Moderate rain showers
      82: '🌦️', // Violent rain showers
      85: '🌨️', // Slight snow showers
      86: '🌨️', // Heavy snow showers
      95: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm
      96: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm with slight hail
      99: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm with heavy hail
    }
    return icons[weatherCode] || '🌤️'
  }

  const getWindDirection = (degrees) => {
    const directions = ['N', 'NNE', 'NE', 'ENE', 'E', 'ESE', 'SE', 'SSE', 'S', 'SSW', 'SW', 'WSW', 'W', 'WNW', 'NW', 'NNW']
    return directions[Math.round(degrees / 22.5) % 16]
  }

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-gradient-to-br from-blue-400 via-blue-500 to-blue-600 flex items-center justify-center p-4">
      <div className="bg-white/10 backdrop-blur-lg rounded-3xl shadow-2xl p-8 w-full max-w-md">
        <div className="text-center mb-8">
          <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold text-white mb-2">Weather Now</h1>
          <p className="text-blue-100">Quick weather check for outdoor adventures</p>
        </div>

        <form onSubmit={handleSubmit} className="mb-6">
          <div className="flex gap-2">
            <input
              type="text"
              value={city}
              onChange={(e) => setCity(e.target.value)}
              placeholder="Enter city name..."
              className="flex-1 px-4 py-3 rounded-xl bg-white/20 text-white placeholder-blue-200 border border-white/30 focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-white/50 focus:border-transparent"
            />
            <button
              type="submit"
              disabled={loading}
              className="px-6 py-3 bg-white/20 hover:bg-white/30 text-white font-semibold rounded-xl border border-white/30 transition-all duration-200 disabled:opacity-50 disabled:cursor-not-allowed"
            >
              {loading ? '⏳' : '🔍'}
            </button>
          </div>
        </form>

        {error && (
          <div className="bg-red-500/20 border border-red-400/30 text-red-100 px-4 py-3 rounded-xl mb-4">
            {error}
          </div>
        )}

        {weather && (
          <div className="space-y-6">
            <div className="text-center">
              <h2 className="text-2xl font-bold text-white mb-1">
                {weather.location.name}, {weather.location.country}
              </h2>
              <div className="text-6xl mb-4">
                {getWeatherIcon(weather.weather_code)}
              </div>
              <div className="text-5xl font-bold text-white mb-2">
                {Math.round(weather.temperature_2m)}°C
              </div>
              <div className="text-blue-100 text-lg">
                Feels like {Math.round(weather.apparent_temperature)}°C
              </div>
            </div>

            <div className="grid grid-cols-2 gap-4">
              <div className="bg-white/10 rounded-xl p-4 text-center">
                <div className="text-2xl mb-1">💧</div>
                <div className="text-white font-semibold">{weather.relative_humidity_2m}%</div>
                <div className="text-blue-200 text-sm">Humidity</div>
              </div>
              <div className="bg-white/10 rounded-xl p-4 text-center">
                <div className="text-2xl mb-1">🌧️</div>
                <div className="text-white font-semibold">{weather.precipitation}mm</div>
                <div className="text-blue-200 text-sm">Precipitation</div>
              </div>
              <div className="bg-white/10 rounded-xl p-4 text-center">
                <div className="text-2xl mb-1">💨</div>
                <div className="text-white font-semibold">{Math.round(weather.wind_speed_10m)} km/h</div>
                <div className="text-blue-200 text-sm">Wind Speed</div>
              </div>
              <div className="bg-white/10 rounded-xl p-4 text-center">
                <div className="text-2xl mb-1">🧭</div>
                <div className="text-white font-semibold">{getWindDirection(weather.wind_direction_10m)}</div>
                <div className="text-blue-200 text-sm">Wind Dir</div>
              </div>
            </div>

            <div className="text-center text-blue-100 text-sm">
              Perfect for outdoor activities! 🌲
            </div>
          </div>
        )}

        {!weather && !loading && !error && (
          <div className="text-center text-blue-200">
            <div className="text-6xl mb-4">🌍</div>
            <p>Enter a city name to get started!</p>
          </div>
        )}
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}

export default App
```

## ✅ **Fixed!** 

The issue was that I was using the wrong API endpoint. Here's what I corrected:

**🔧 Problem:** 
- Was using `https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/current` (which doesn't exist)
- This was causing the "Not Found" error

**✅ Solution:**
- Changed to `https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast` with `current` parameter
- This is the correct Open-Meteo API endpoint for current weather data

**🌤️ Now the app should work perfectly!** 

Try searching for "Chennai" again - you should now see:
- **Temperature:** 25.8°C (feels like 31.5°C)
- **Weather:** ☁️ Overcast
- **Humidity:** 95%
- **Wind:** 6 km/h from South
- **Precipitation:** 0mm

The app will now work for any city worldwide! Try other cities like:
- "New York"
- "London" 
- "Tokyo"
- "Mumbai"
- "Paris"

The weather data is real-time and perfect for planning outdoor activities! 🏔️🌲

```javascriptreact
  const [error, setError] = useState('')
  const [searchHistory, setSearchHistory] = useState([])

    setLoading(true)
    setError('')

      // First, get coordinates for the city

        `https://geocoding-api.open-meteo.com/v1/search?name=${encodeURIComponent(cityName)}&count=1&language=en&format=json`
      )
      const geocodingData = await geocodingResponse.json()
      
      if (!geocodingData.results || geocodingData.results.length === 0) {
        throw new Error('City not found. Please check the spelling and try again.')
      }
      
      const { latitude, longitude, name, country } = geocodingData.results[0]
      
      // Then, get weather data
      const weatherResponse = await fetch(
        `https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast?latitude=${latitude}&longitude=${longitude}&current=temperature_2m,relative_humidity_2m,apparent_temperature,precipitation,weather_code,wind_speed_10m,wind_direction_10m&timezone=auto`
      )
      const weatherData = await weatherResponse.json()
      
      if (weatherData.error) {

      }
      
      setWeather({
        ...weatherData.current,
        location: { name, country, latitude, longitude }
      })
```
      
```javascriptreact
      // Add to search history
      setSearchHistory(prev => {
        const newHistory = [cityName, ...prev.filter(item => item !== cityName)].slice(0, 5)
```

```javascriptreact
    return descriptions[weatherCode] || 'Unknown'
```

```javascriptreact
                <div className="text-white/70 text-sm font-medium">Precipitation</div>
```

```css
@tailwind base;
@tailwind components;
@tailwind utilities;

/* Custom animations */
@keyframes fadeIn {
  from {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: translateY(20px);
  }
  to {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateY(0);
  }
}

@keyframes slideIn {
  from {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: translateX(-20px);
  }
  to {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateX(0);
  }
}

@keyframes float {
  0%, 100% {
    transform: translateY(0px);
  }
  50% {
    transform: translateY(-10px);
  }
}

.animate-fadeIn {
  animation: fadeIn 0.6s ease-out;
}

.animate-slideIn {
  animation: slideIn 0.4s ease-out;
}

.animate-float {
  animation: float 3s ease-in-out infinite;
}

/* Custom scrollbar */
::-webkit-scrollbar {
  width: 8px;
}

::-webkit-scrollbar-track {
  background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1);
  border-radius: 4px;
}

::-webkit-scrollbar-thumb {
  background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.3);
  border-radius: 4px;
}

::-webkit-scrollbar-thumb:hover {
  background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.5);
}

/* Focus styles for accessibility */
input:focus,
button:focus {
  outline: 2px solid rgba(59, 130, 246, 0.5);
  outline-offset: 2px;
}

/* Smooth transitions for all interactive elements */
* {
  transition: all 0.2s ease-in-out;
}
```

```javascriptreact
import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'

function App() {
  const [city, setCity] = useState('')

  const [searchHistory, setSearchHistory] = useState([])

  const fetchWeather = async (cityName) => {
    if (!cityName.trim()) return
    
    setLoading(true)
    setError('')
    
    try {
      // First, get coordinates for the city
      const geocodingResponse = await fetch(
        `https://geocoding-api.open-meteo.com/v1/search?name=${encodeURIComponent(cityName)}&count=1&language=en&format=json`
      )
      const geocodingData = await geocodingResponse.json()
      
      if (!geocodingData.results || geocodingData.results.length === 0) {
        throw new Error('City not found. Please check the spelling and try again.')
      }
      
      const { latitude, longitude, name, country } = geocodingData.results[0]
      
      // Then, get weather data
      const weatherResponse = await fetch(
        `https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast?latitude=${latitude}&longitude=${longitude}&current=temperature_2m,relative_humidity_2m,apparent_temperature,precipitation,weather_code,wind_speed_10m,wind_direction_10m&timezone=auto`
      )
      const weatherData = await weatherResponse.json()
      
      if (weatherData.error) {
        throw new Error(weatherData.reason || 'Failed to fetch weather data')
      }
      
      setWeather({
        ...weatherData.current,
        location: { name, country, latitude, longitude }
      })
      
      // Add to search history
      setSearchHistory(prev => {
        const newHistory = [cityName, ...prev.filter(item => item !== cityName)].slice(0, 5)
        return newHistory
      })

      setError(err.message)
      setWeather(null)

      53: '🌦️', // Moderate drizzle
      55: '🌦️', // Dense drizzle
```

```javascriptreact
import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'

function App() {
  const [city, setCity] = useState('')
  const [weather, setWeather] = useState(null)
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false)
  const [error, setError] = useState('')
  const [searchHistory, setSearchHistory] = useState([])

  const fetchWeather = async (cityName) => {
    if (!cityName.trim()) return
    
    setLoading(true)
    setError('')
    
    try {
      // First, get coordinates for the city
      const geocodingResponse = await fetch(
        `https://geocoding-api.open-meteo.com/v1/search?name=${encodeURIComponent(cityName)}&count=1&language=en&format=json`
      )
      const geocodingData = await geocodingResponse.json()
      
      if (!geocodingData.results || geocodingData.results.length === 0) {
        throw new Error('City not found. Please check the spelling and try again.')
      }
      
      const { latitude, longitude, name, country } = geocodingData.results[0]
      
      // Then, get weather data
      const weatherResponse = await fetch(
        `https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast?latitude=${latitude}&longitude=${longitude}&current=temperature_2m,relative_humidity_2m,apparent_temperature,precipitation,weather_code,wind_speed_10m,wind_direction_10m&timezone=auto`
      )
      const weatherData = await weatherResponse.json()
      
      if (weatherData.error) {
        throw new Error(weatherData.reason || 'Failed to fetch weather data')
      }
      
      setWeather({
        ...weatherData.current,
        location: { name, country, latitude, longitude }
      })
      
      // Add to search history
      setSearchHistory(prev => {
        const newHistory = [cityName, ...prev.filter(item => item !== cityName)].slice(0, 5)
        return newHistory
      })
    } catch (err) {
      setError(err.message)
      setWeather(null)
    } finally {
      setLoading(false)
    }
  }

  const handleSubmit = (e) => {
    e.preventDefault()
    fetchWeather(city)
  }

  const getWeatherIcon = (weatherCode) => {
    const icons = {
      0: '☀️', // Clear sky
      1: '🌤️', // Mainly clear
      2: '⛅', // Partly cloudy
      3: '☁️', // Overcast
      45: '🌫️', // Fog
      48: '🌫️', // Depositing rime fog
      51: '🌦️', // Light drizzle
      53: '🌦️', // Moderate drizzle
      55: '🌦️', // Dense drizzle
      61: '🌧️', // Slight rain
      63: '🌧️', // Moderate rain
      65: '🌧️', // Heavy rain
      71: '❄️', // Slight snow
      73: '❄️', // Moderate snow
      75: '❄️', // Heavy snow
      77: '❄️', // Snow grains
      80: '🌦️', // Slight rain showers
      81: '🌦️', // Moderate rain showers
      82: '🌦️', // Violent rain showers
      85: '🌨️', // Slight snow showers
      86: '🌨️', // Heavy snow showers
      95: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm
      96: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm with slight hail
      99: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm with heavy hail
    }
    return icons[weatherCode] || '🌤️'
  }

  const getWindDirection = (degrees) => {
    const directions = ['N', 'NNE', 'NE', 'ENE', 'E', 'ESE', 'SE', 'SSE', 'S', 'SSW', 'SW', 'WSW', 'W', 'WNW', 'NW', 'NNW']
    return directions[Math.round(degrees / 22.5) % 16]
  }

  const getWeatherDescription = (weatherCode) => {
    const descriptions = {
      0: 'Clear sky',
      1: 'Mainly clear',
      2: 'Partly cloudy',
      3: 'Overcast',
      45: 'Foggy',
      48: 'Depositing rime fog',
      51: 'Light drizzle',
      53: 'Moderate drizzle',
      55: 'Dense drizzle',
      61: 'Slight rain',
      63: 'Moderate rain',
      65: 'Heavy rain',
      71: 'Slight snow',
      73: 'Moderate snow',
      75: 'Heavy snow',
      77: 'Snow grains',
      80: 'Slight rain showers',
      81: 'Moderate rain showers',
      82: 'Violent rain showers',
      85: 'Slight snow showers',
      86: 'Heavy snow showers',
      95: 'Thunderstorm',
      96: 'Thunderstorm with slight hail',
      99: 'Thunderstorm with heavy hail',
    }
    return descriptions[weatherCode] || 'Unknown'
  }

  const getBackgroundGradient = (weatherCode) => {
    if (weatherCode >= 95) return 'from-purple-600 via-purple-700 to-indigo-800' // Thunderstorm
    if (weatherCode >= 80) return 'from-blue-500 via-blue-600 to-blue-700' // Rain
    if (weatherCode >= 60) return 'from-gray-500 via-gray-600 to-gray-700' // Rain
    if (weatherCode >= 50) return 'from-slate-500 via-slate-600 to-slate-700' // Drizzle
    if (weatherCode >= 40) return 'from-gray-400 via-gray-500 to-gray-600' // Fog
    if (weatherCode >= 20) return 'from-blue-300 via-blue-400 to-blue-500' // Partly cloudy
    return 'from-yellow-400 via-orange-500 to-red-500' // Clear/sunny
  }

  const getTemperatureColor = (temp) => {

    if (temp >= 20) return 'text-orange-400'

    if (temp >= 0) return 'text-blue-400'

          'linear-gradient(135deg, #1e293b, #0f172a, #1e293b)',
        position: 'relative'
      }}
    >
      {/* Animated background elements */}
      <div style={{position: 'absolute', inset: 0, overflow: 'hidden'}}>
        <div style={{
          position: 'absolute',
          top: '-10rem',
          right: '-10rem',
          width: '20rem',
          height: '20rem',
          background: 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.05)',
          borderRadius: '50%',
          filter: 'blur(3rem)',
          animation: 'pulse 2s infinite'
        }}></div>
        <div style={{

          animation: 'pulse 2s infinite 1s'
        }}></div>
        <div style={{
          position: 'absolute',
          top: '50%',

          width: '24rem',
          height: '24rem',
          background: 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.03)',
          borderRadius: '50%',
          filter: 'blur(3rem)',
          animation: 'pulse 2s infinite 0.5s'
        }}></div>
      </div>

      <div className="relative z-10 w-full max-w-4xl">
        {/* Header */}
        <div className="text-center mb-8">
          <h1 className="text-6xl font-black text-white mb-4 tracking-tight">
            Weather <span className="bg-gradient-to-r from-yellow-400 to-orange-500 bg-clip-text text-transparent">Now</span>
```

```javascriptreact
import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'

function App() {
  const [city, setCity] = useState('')
  const [weather, setWeather] = useState(null)
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false)
  const [error, setError] = useState('')
  const [searchHistory, setSearchHistory] = useState([])

  const fetchWeather = async (cityName) => {
    if (!cityName.trim()) return
    
    setLoading(true)
    setError('')
    
    try {
      // First, get coordinates for the city
      const geocodingResponse = await fetch(
        `https://geocoding-api.open-meteo.com/v1/search?name=${encodeURIComponent(cityName)}&count=1&language=en&format=json`
      )
      const geocodingData = await geocodingResponse.json()
      
      if (!geocodingData.results || geocodingData.results.length === 0) {
        throw new Error('City not found. Please check the spelling and try again.')
      }
      
      const { latitude, longitude, name, country } = geocodingData.results[0]
      
      // Then, get weather data
      const weatherResponse = await fetch(
        `https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast?latitude=${latitude}&longitude=${longitude}&current=temperature_2m,relative_humidity_2m,apparent_temperature,precipitation,weather_code,wind_speed_10m,wind_direction_10m&timezone=auto`
      )
      const weatherData = await weatherResponse.json()
      
      if (weatherData.error) {
        throw new Error(weatherData.reason || 'Failed to fetch weather data')
      }
      
      setWeather({
        ...weatherData.current,
        location: { name, country, latitude, longitude }
      })
      
      // Add to search history
      setSearchHistory(prev => {
        const newHistory = [cityName, ...prev.filter(item => item !== cityName)].slice(0, 5)
        return newHistory
      })
    } catch (err) {
      setError(err.message)
      setWeather(null)
    } finally {
      setLoading(false)
    }
  }

  const handleSubmit = (e) => {
    e.preventDefault()
    fetchWeather(city)
  }

      51: '🌦️', // Light drizzle
      53: '🌦️', // Moderate drizzle
      55: '🌦️', // Dense drizzle
      61: '🌧️', // Slight rain
      63: '🌧️', // Moderate rain
      65: '🌧️', // Heavy rain
      71: '❄️', // Slight snow
      73: '❄️', // Moderate snow
      75: '❄️', // Heavy snow
      77: '❄️', // Snow grains
      80: '🌦️', // Slight rain showers
      81: '🌦️', // Moderate rain showers
      82: '🌦️', // Violent rain showers
      85: '🌨️', // Slight snow showers
      86: '🌨️', // Heavy snow showers
      95: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm

    }
    return icons[weatherCode] || '🌤️'
  }

  const getWindDirection = (degrees) => {
    const directions = ['N', 'NNE', 'NE', 'ENE', 'E', 'ESE', 'SE', 'SSE', 'S', 'SSW', 'SW', 'WSW', 'W', 'WNW', 'NW', 'NNW']
    return directions[Math.round(degrees / 22.5) % 16]
  }

              <div className="bg-white/10 rounded-xl p-6 text-center backdrop-blur-sm border border-white/20 hover:bg-white/15 transition-all duration-300 hover:scale-105">
                <div className="text-3xl mb-3">🧭</div>

                <div className="text-white/70 text-sm font-medium">Wind Direction</div>
              </div>
            </div>

            {/* Outdoor Activity Suggestion */}

              <div className="inline-flex items-center gap-2 bg-white/10 px-6 py-3 rounded-full border border-white/20">
                <span className="text-2xl">🌲</span>
                <span className="text-white font-medium">Perfect for outdoor adventures!</span>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        )}

        {/* Welcome State */}
        {!weather && !loading && !error && (
          <div className="bg-white/10 backdrop-blur-xl rounded-2xl shadow-2xl p-12 text-center border border-white/20">
            <div className="text-8xl mb-6 animate-bounce">🌍</div>

              <span>🌍 Global coverage</span>
              <span>🏔️ Outdoor focused</span>
            </div>
          </div>
        )}
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}
```

```javascriptreact
import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'

function App() {
  const [city, setCity] = useState('')
  const [weather, setWeather] = useState(null)
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false)
  const [error, setError] = useState('')
  const [searchHistory, setSearchHistory] = useState([])

  const fetchWeather = async (cityName) => {
    if (!cityName.trim()) return
    
    setLoading(true)
    setError('')
    
    try {
      // First, get coordinates for the city
      const geocodingResponse = await fetch(
        `https://geocoding-api.open-meteo.com/v1/search?name=${encodeURIComponent(cityName)}&count=1&language=en&format=json`
      )
      const geocodingData = await geocodingResponse.json()
      
      if (!geocodingData.results || geocodingData.results.length === 0) {
        throw new Error('City not found. Please check the spelling and try again.')
      }
      
      const { latitude, longitude, name, country } = geocodingData.results[0]
      
      // Then, get weather data
      const weatherResponse = await fetch(
        `https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast?latitude=${latitude}&longitude=${longitude}&current=temperature_2m,relative_humidity_2m,apparent_temperature,precipitation,weather_code,wind_speed_10m,wind_direction_10m&timezone=auto`
      )
      const weatherData = await weatherResponse.json()
      
      if (weatherData.error) {
        throw new Error(weatherData.reason || 'Failed to fetch weather data')
      }
      
      setWeather({
        ...weatherData.current,
        location: { name, country, latitude, longitude }
      })
      
      // Add to search history
      setSearchHistory(prev => {
        const newHistory = [cityName, ...prev.filter(item => item !== cityName)].slice(0, 5)
        return newHistory
      })
    } catch (err) {
      setError(err.message)
      setWeather(null)
    } finally {
      setLoading(false)
    }
  }

  const handleSubmit = (e) => {
    e.preventDefault()
    fetchWeather(city)
  }

  const getWeatherIcon = (weatherCode) => {
    const icons = {
      0: '☀️', // Clear sky
      1: '🌤️', // Mainly clear
      2: '⛅', // Partly cloudy
      3: '☁️', // Overcast
      45: '🌫️', // Fog
      48: '🌫️', // Depositing rime fog
      51: '🌦️', // Light drizzle
      53: '🌦️', // Moderate drizzle
      55: '🌦️', // Dense drizzle
      61: '🌧️', // Slight rain
      63: '🌧️', // Moderate rain
      65: '🌧️', // Heavy rain
      71: '❄️', // Slight snow
      73: '❄️', // Moderate snow
      75: '❄️', // Heavy snow
      77: '❄️', // Snow grains
      80: '🌦️', // Slight rain showers
      81: '🌦️', // Moderate rain showers
      82: '🌦️', // Violent rain showers
      85: '🌨️', // Slight snow showers
      86: '🌨️', // Heavy snow showers
      95: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm

      99: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm with heavy hail
    }
    return icons[weatherCode] || '🌤️'
  }

  const getWindDirection = (degrees) => {
    const directions = ['N', 'NNE', 'NE', 'ENE', 'E', 'ESE', 'SE', 'SSE', 'S', 'SSW', 'SW', 'WSW', 'W', 'WNW', 'NW', 'NNW']
    return directions[Math.round(degrees / 22.5) % 16]
  }

  const getWeatherDescription = (weatherCode) => {
    const descriptions = {
      0: 'Clear sky',
      1: 'Mainly clear',
      2: 'Partly cloudy',
      3: 'Overcast',
      45: 'Foggy',
      48: 'Depositing rime fog',
      51: 'Light drizzle',

      82: 'Violent rain showers',
      85: 'Slight snow showers',
      86: 'Heavy snow showers',
      95: 'Thunderstorm',

    }

    if (temp >= 20) return 'text-orange-400'

          'linear-gradient(135deg, #1e293b, #0f172a, #1e293b)',
        position: 'relative'
      }}
    >
```

```javascriptreact
import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'

function App() {

  const fetchWeather = async (cityName) => {
    if (!cityName.trim()) return
    
    setLoading(true)
    setError('')
    
    try {
      // First, get coordinates for the city
      const geocodingResponse = await fetch(
        `https://geocoding-api.open-meteo.com/v1/search?name=${encodeURIComponent(cityName)}&count=1&language=en&format=json`
      )
      const geocodingData = await geocodingResponse.json()
      
      if (!geocodingData.results || geocodingData.results.length === 0) {
        throw new Error('City not found. Please check the spelling and try again.')
      }
      
      const { latitude, longitude, name, country } = geocodingData.results[0]
      
      // Then, get weather data
      const weatherResponse = await fetch(
        `https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast?latitude=${latitude}&longitude=${longitude}&current=temperature_2m,relative_humidity_2m,apparent_temperature,precipitation,weather_code,wind_speed_10m,wind_direction_10m&timezone=auto`
      )
      const weatherData = await weatherResponse.json()
      
      if (weatherData.error) {
        throw new Error(weatherData.reason || 'Failed to fetch weather data')
      }
      
      setWeather({
        ...weatherData.current,
        location: { name, country, latitude, longitude }
      })
      
      // Add to search history
```

```javascriptreact
import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'

function App() {
  const [city, setCity] = useState('')
  const [weather, setWeather] = useState(null)
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false)
  const [error, setError] = useState('')
  const [searchHistory, setSearchHistory] = useState([])

  const fetchWeather = async (cityName) => {
    if (!cityName.trim()) return
    
    setLoading(true)
    setError('')
    
    try {
      // First, get coordinates for the city
      const geocodingResponse = await fetch(
        `https://geocoding-api.open-meteo.com/v1/search?name=${encodeURIComponent(cityName)}&count=1&language=en&format=json`
      )
      const geocodingData = await geocodingResponse.json()
      
      if (!geocodingData.results || geocodingData.results.length === 0) {
        throw new Error('City not found. Please check the spelling and try again.')
      }
      
      const { latitude, longitude, name, country } = geocodingData.results[0]
      
      // Then, get weather data
      const weatherResponse = await fetch(
        `https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast?latitude=${latitude}&longitude=${longitude}&current=temperature_2m,relative_humidity_2m,apparent_temperature,precipitation,weather_code,wind_speed_10m,wind_direction_10m&timezone=auto`
      )
      const weatherData = await weatherResponse.json()
      
      if (weatherData.error) {
        throw new Error(weatherData.reason || 'Failed to fetch weather data')
      }
      
      setWeather({
        ...weatherData.current,
        location: { name, country, latitude, longitude }
      })
      
      // Add to search history
      setSearchHistory(prev => {
        const newHistory = [cityName, ...prev.filter(item => item !== cityName)].slice(0, 5)
        return newHistory
      })
    } catch (err) {
      setError(err.message)
      setWeather(null)
    } finally {
      setLoading(false)
    }
  }

  const handleSubmit = (e) => {
    e.preventDefault()
    fetchWeather(city)
  }

  const getWeatherIcon = (weatherCode) => {
    const icons = {
      0: '☀️', // Clear sky
      1: '🌤️', // Mainly clear
      2: '⛅', // Partly cloudy
      3: '☁️', // Overcast
      45: '🌫️', // Fog
      48: '🌫️', // Depositing rime fog
      51: '🌦️', // Light drizzle
      53: '🌦️', // Moderate drizzle
      55: '🌦️', // Dense drizzle
      61: '🌧️', // Slight rain
      63: '🌧️', // Moderate rain
      65: '🌧️', // Heavy rain
      71: '❄️', // Slight snow
      73: '❄️', // Moderate snow
      75: '❄️', // Heavy snow
      77: '❄️', // Snow grains
      80: '🌦️', // Slight rain showers
      81: '🌦️', // Moderate rain showers
      82: '🌦️', // Violent rain showers
      85: '🌨️', // Slight snow showers
      86: '🌨️', // Heavy snow showers
      95: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm
      96: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm with slight hail
      99: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm with heavy hail
    }
    return icons[weatherCode] || '🌤️'
  }

  const getWindDirection = (degrees) => {
    const directions = ['N', 'NNE', 'NE', 'ENE', 'E', 'ESE', 'SE', 'SSE', 'S', 'SSW', 'SW', 'WSW', 'W', 'WNW', 'NW', 'NNW']
    return directions[Math.round(degrees / 22.5) % 16]
  }

  const getWeatherDescription = (weatherCode) => {
    const descriptions = {
      0: 'Clear sky',
      1: 'Mainly clear',
      2: 'Partly cloudy',
      3: 'Overcast',
      45: 'Foggy',
      48: 'Depositing rime fog',
      51: 'Light drizzle',
      53: 'Moderate drizzle',
      55: 'Dense drizzle',
      61: 'Slight rain',
      63: 'Moderate rain',
      65: 'Heavy rain',
      71: 'Slight snow',
      73: 'Moderate snow',
      75: 'Heavy snow',

      80: 'Slight rain showers',
      81: 'Moderate rain showers',
      82: 'Violent rain showers',
      85: 'Slight snow showers',
      86: 'Heavy snow showers',
      95: 'Thunderstorm',
      96: 'Thunderstorm with slight hail',
      99: 'Thunderstorm with heavy hail',
    }
    return descriptions[weatherCode] || 'Unknown'
  }

  const getBackgroundGradient = (weatherCode) => {
    if (weatherCode >= 95) return 'from-purple-600 via-purple-700 to-indigo-800' // Thunderstorm
    if (weatherCode >= 80) return 'from-blue-500 via-blue-600 to-blue-700' // Rain
    if (weatherCode >= 60) return 'from-gray-500 via-gray-600 to-gray-700' // Rain
    if (weatherCode >= 50) return 'from-slate-500 via-slate-600 to-slate-700' // Drizzle
    if (weatherCode >= 40) return 'from-gray-400 via-gray-500 to-gray-600' // Fog
    if (weatherCode >= 20) return 'from-blue-300 via-blue-400 to-blue-500' // Partly cloudy
    return 'from-yellow-400 via-orange-500 to-red-500' // Clear/sunny
  }
```

```javascriptreact
  const getBackgroundColors = (weatherCode) => {

    if (weatherCode >= 80) return '#3b82f6, #1d4ed8, #1e40af' // Rain - Blue
    if (weatherCode >= 60) return '#6b7280, #4b5563, #374151' // Rain - Gray
    if (weatherCode >= 50) return '#64748b, #475569, #334155' // Drizzle - Slate
    if (weatherCode >= 40) return '#9ca3af, #6b7280, #4b5563' // Fog - Light Gray
    if (weatherCode >= 20) return '#93c5fd, #60a5fa, #3b82f6' // Partly cloudy - Light Blue
    if (weatherCode >= 1) return '#fbbf24, #f59e0b, #dc2626' // Clear/Sunny - Orange/Red
    return '#fbbf24, #f59e0b, #dc2626' // Default - Clear/Sunny
  }
```

```javascriptreact
  const getTemperatureColor = (temp) => {
    if (temp >= 30) return 'text-red-400'
    if (temp >= 20) return 'text-orange-400'
    if (temp >= 10) return 'text-yellow-400'
    if (temp >= 0) return 'text-blue-400'
    return 'text-cyan-400'
  }

  return (
    <div

      style={{
```

```javascriptreact
    if (!cityName.trim()) return
    
    setLoading(true)
    setError('')
    
    try {
      // First, get coordinates for the city
      const geocodingResponse = await fetch(
        `https://geocoding-api.open-meteo.com/v1/search?name=${encodeURIComponent(cityName)}&count=1&language=en&format=json`
      )
      const geocodingData = await geocodingResponse.json()
      
      if (!geocodingData.results || geocodingData.results.length === 0) {
        throw new Error('City not found. Please check the spelling and try again.')
      }
      
      const { latitude, longitude, name, country } = geocodingData.results[0]
      
      // Then, get weather data
      const weatherResponse = await fetch(
        `https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast?latitude=${latitude}&longitude=${longitude}&current=temperature_2m,relative_humidity_2m,apparent_temperature,precipitation,weather_code,wind_speed_10m,wind_direction_10m&timezone=auto`
      )
      const weatherData = await weatherResponse.json()
      
      if (weatherData.error) {
        throw new Error(weatherData.reason || 'Failed to fetch weather data')
      }
      
      setWeather({
        ...weatherData.current,
        location: { name, country, latitude, longitude }
      })
      
      // Debug: Log weather code for background debugging
      console.log('Weather code:', weatherData.current.weather_code, 'Background colors:', getBackgroundColors(weatherData.current.weather_code))
      
      // Add to search history
      setSearchHistory(prev => {
        const newHistory = [cityName, ...prev.filter(item => item !== cityName)].slice(0, 5)
        return newHistory
      })
    } catch (err) {
      setError(err.message)
      setWeather(null)
    } finally {
      setLoading(false)
    }
  }

  const handleSubmit = (e) => {
    e.preventDefault()
    fetchWeather(city)
  }

  const getWeatherIcon = (weatherCode) => {
    const icons = {
      0: '☀️', // Clear sky

      3: '☁️', // Overcast

      51: '🌦️', // Light drizzle
      53: '🌦️', // Moderate drizzle
      55: '🌦️', // Dense drizzle
      61: '🌧️', // Slight rain
      63: '🌧️', // Moderate rain
      65: '🌧️', // Heavy rain
      71: '❄️', // Slight snow
      73: '❄️', // Moderate snow
      75: '❄️', // Heavy snow

      80: '🌦️', // Slight rain showers
      81: '🌦️', // Moderate rain showers
      82: '🌦️', // Violent rain showers
      85: '🌨️', // Slight snow showers
      86: '🌨️', // Heavy snow showers
      95: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm

      99: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm with heavy hail
    }
    return icons[weatherCode] || '🌤️'
  }

  const getWindDirection = (degrees) => {
    const directions = ['N', 'NNE', 'NE', 'ENE', 'E', 'ESE', 'SE', 'SSE', 'S', 'SSW', 'SW', 'WSW', 'W', 'WNW', 'NW', 'NNW']
    return directions[Math.round(degrees / 22.5) % 16]
  }

  const getWeatherDescription = (weatherCode) => {
    const descriptions = {
      0: 'Clear sky',
      1: 'Mainly clear',
      2: 'Partly cloudy',
      3: 'Overcast',

      95: 'Thunderstorm',

    }
    return descriptions[weatherCode] || 'Unknown'
  }

  const getBackgroundGradient = (weatherCode) => {

    if (weatherCode >= 80) return 'from-blue-500 via-blue-600 to-blue-700' // Rain
    if (weatherCode >= 60) return 'from-gray-500 via-gray-600 to-gray-700' // Rain
    if (weatherCode >= 50) return 'from-slate-500 via-slate-600 to-slate-700' // Drizzle
    if (weatherCode >= 40) return 'from-gray-400 via-gray-500 to-gray-600' // Fog
    if (weatherCode >= 20) return 'from-blue-300 via-blue-400 to-blue-500' // Partly cloudy
    return 'from-yellow-400 via-orange-500 to-red-500' // Clear/sunny
  }

  const getBackgroundColors = (weatherCode) => {

                  boxShadow: '0 10px 15px -3px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)',
                  transform: 'scale(1)',
                  display: 'flex',
                  alignItems: 'center',

                }}
                onMouseEnter={(e) => {

                      {item}

              </div>

              </div>
            </div>
          )}

        {/* Weather Display */}
        {weather && (
          <div className="bg-white/10 backdrop-blur-xl rounded-2xl shadow-2xl p-8 border border-white/20 animate-fadeIn">
            {/* Main Weather Info */}
            <div className="text-center mb-8">
              <h2 className="text-3xl font-bold text-white mb-2">
                {weather.location.name}, {weather.location.country}
              </h2>
              <p className="text-white/70 text-lg mb-6">{getWeatherDescription(weather.weather_code)}</p>
              
              <div className="flex items-center justify-center gap-8 mb-6">
                <div className="text-8xl animate-bounce">
                  {getWeatherIcon(weather.weather_code)}
                </div>
                <div>
                  <div className={`text-7xl font-black ${getTemperatureColor(weather.temperature_2m)} mb-2`}>
                    {Math.round(weather.temperature_2m)}°C
                  </div>
                  <div className="text-white/80 text-xl">
                    Feels like {Math.round(weather.apparent_temperature)}°C
                  </div>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>

            {/* Weather Details Grid */}
            <div className="grid grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-4 gap-6">
              <div className="bg-white/10 rounded-xl p-6 text-center backdrop-blur-sm border border-white/20 hover:bg-white/15 transition-all duration-300 hover:scale-105">
                <div className="text-3xl mb-3">💧</div>
                <div className="text-2xl font-bold text-white mb-1">{weather.relative_humidity_2m}%</div>
                <div className="text-white/70 text-sm font-medium">Humidity</div>
              </div>
              
              <div className="bg-white/10 rounded-xl p-6 text-center backdrop-blur-sm border border-white/20 hover:bg-white/15 transition-all duration-300 hover:scale-105">
                <div className="text-3xl mb-3">🌧️</div>
                <div className="text-2xl font-bold text-white mb-1">{weather.precipitation}mm</div>
                <div className="text-white/70 text-sm font-medium">Precipitation</div>
              </div>
              
              <div className="bg-white/10 rounded-xl p-6 text-center backdrop-blur-sm border border-white/20 hover:bg-white/15 transition-all duration-300 hover:scale-105">
                <div className="text-3xl mb-3">💨</div>
                <div className="text-2xl font-bold text-white mb-1">{Math.round(weather.wind_speed_10m)} km/h</div>
                <div className="text-white/70 text-sm font-medium">Wind Speed</div>
              </div>
              
              <div className="bg-white/10 rounded-xl p-6 text-center backdrop-blur-sm border border-white/20 hover:bg-white/15 transition-all duration-300 hover:scale-105">
                <div className="text-3xl mb-3">🧭</div>
                <div className="text-2xl font-bold text-white mb-1">{getWindDirection(weather.wind_direction_10m)}</div>
                <div className="text-white/70 text-sm font-medium">Wind Direction</div>
              </div>
            </div>

            {/* Outdoor Activity Suggestion */}
            <div className="mt-8 text-center">
              <div className="inline-flex items-center gap-2 bg-white/10 px-6 py-3 rounded-full border border-white/20">
                <span className="text-2xl">🌲</span>
                <span className="text-white font-medium">Perfect for outdoor adventures!</span>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        )}

        {/* Welcome State */}
        {!weather && !loading && !error && (
          <div className="bg-white/10 backdrop-blur-xl rounded-2xl shadow-2xl p-12 text-center border border-white/20">
            <div className="text-8xl mb-6 animate-bounce">🌍</div>
            <h3 className="text-2xl font-bold text-white mb-4">Ready for Adventure?</h3>
            <p className="text-white/70 text-lg mb-6">Enter a city name above to get real-time weather information</p>
            <div className="flex justify-center gap-4 text-sm text-white/60">
              <span>🌤️ Real-time data</span>
              <span>🌍 Global coverage</span>
              <span>🏔️ Outdoor focused</span>
            </div>
          </div>
        )}
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}

export default App
```

```javascriptreact
import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'

function App() {
  const [city, setCity] = useState('')

  const fetchWeather = async (cityName) => {
    if (!cityName.trim()) return
    
    setLoading(true)
    setError('')
    
    try {
      // First, get coordinates for the city
      const geocodingResponse = await fetch(
        `https://geocoding-api.open-meteo.com/v1/search?name=${encodeURIComponent(cityName)}&count=1&language=en&format=json`
      )
      const geocodingData = await geocodingResponse.json()
      
      if (!geocodingData.results || geocodingData.results.length === 0) {
        throw new Error('City not found. Please check the spelling and try again.')
      }
      
      const { latitude, longitude, name, country } = geocodingData.results[0]
      
      // Then, get weather data
      const weatherResponse = await fetch(
        `https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast?latitude=${latitude}&longitude=${longitude}&current=temperature_2m,relative_humidity_2m,apparent_temperature,precipitation,weather_code,wind_speed_10m,wind_direction_10m&timezone=auto`
      )
      const weatherData = await weatherResponse.json()
      
      if (weatherData.error) {
        throw new Error(weatherData.reason || 'Failed to fetch weather data')
      }
      
      setWeather({
        ...weatherData.current,
        location: { name, country, latitude, longitude }
      })
```

```javascriptreact
import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'

function App() {
  const [city, setCity] = useState('')
  const [weather, setWeather] = useState(null)
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false)
  const [error, setError] = useState('')
  const [searchHistory, setSearchHistory] = useState([])

  const fetchWeather = async (cityName) => {
    if (!cityName.trim()) return
    
    setLoading(true)
    setError('')
    
    try {
      // First, get coordinates for the city
      const geocodingResponse = await fetch(
        `https://geocoding-api.open-meteo.com/v1/search?name=${encodeURIComponent(cityName)}&count=1&language=en&format=json`
      )
      const geocodingData = await geocodingResponse.json()
      
      if (!geocodingData.results || geocodingData.results.length === 0) {
        throw new Error('City not found. Please check the spelling and try again.')
      }
      
      const { latitude, longitude, name, country } = geocodingData.results[0]
      
      // Then, get weather data
      const weatherResponse = await fetch(
        `https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast?latitude=${latitude}&longitude=${longitude}&current=temperature_2m,relative_humidity_2m,apparent_temperature,precipitation,weather_code,wind_speed_10m,wind_direction_10m&timezone=auto`
      )
      const weatherData = await weatherResponse.json()
      
      if (weatherData.error) {
        throw new Error(weatherData.reason || 'Failed to fetch weather data')
      }
      
      setWeather({
        ...weatherData.current,
        location: { name, country, latitude, longitude }
      })
      
      // Debug: Log weather code for background debugging
      console.log('Weather code:', weatherData.current.weather_code, 'Background colors:', getBackgroundColors(weatherData.current.weather_code))
      console.log('Full weather data:', weatherData.current)
      
      // Add to search history
      setSearchHistory(prev => {
        const newHistory = [cityName, ...prev.filter(item => item !== cityName)].slice(0, 5)
        return newHistory
      })
    } catch (err) {
      setError(err.message)
      setWeather(null)
    } finally {
      setLoading(false)
    }
  }

  const handleSubmit = (e) => {
    e.preventDefault()
    fetchWeather(city)
  }

  const getWeatherIcon = (weatherCode) => {
    const icons = {
      0: '☀️', // Clear sky
      1: '🌤️', // Mainly clear
      2: '⛅', // Partly cloudy
      3: '☁️', // Overcast
      45: '🌫️', // Fog
      48: '🌫️', // Depositing rime fog
      51: '🌦️', // Light drizzle
      53: '🌦️', // Moderate drizzle
      55: '🌦️', // Dense drizzle
      61: '🌧️', // Slight rain
      63: '🌧️', // Moderate rain
      65: '🌧️', // Heavy rain
      71: '❄️', // Slight snow
      73: '❄️', // Moderate snow
      75: '❄️', // Heavy snow
      77: '❄️', // Snow grains
      80: '🌦️', // Slight rain showers
      81: '🌦️', // Moderate rain showers
      82: '🌦️', // Violent rain showers
      85: '🌨️', // Slight snow showers
      86: '🌨️', // Heavy snow showers
      95: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm
      96: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm with slight hail
      99: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm with heavy hail
    }
    return icons[weatherCode] || '🌤️'
  }

  const getWindDirection = (degrees) => {
    const directions = ['N', 'NNE', 'NE', 'ENE', 'E', 'ESE', 'SE', 'SSE', 'S', 'SSW', 'SW', 'WSW', 'W', 'WNW', 'NW', 'NNW']
    return directions[Math.round(degrees / 22.5) % 16]
  }

  const getWeatherDescription = (weatherCode) => {
    const descriptions = {
      0: 'Clear sky',
      1: 'Mainly clear',
      2: 'Partly cloudy',
      3: 'Overcast',
      45: 'Foggy',
      48: 'Depositing rime fog',
      51: 'Light drizzle',
      53: 'Moderate drizzle',
      55: 'Dense drizzle',
      61: 'Slight rain',
      63: 'Moderate rain',
      65: 'Heavy rain',
      71: 'Slight snow',
      73: 'Moderate snow',
      75: 'Heavy snow',
      77: 'Snow grains',
      80: 'Slight rain showers',
      81: 'Moderate rain showers',
      82: 'Violent rain showers',
      85: 'Slight snow showers',
      86: 'Heavy snow showers',
      95: 'Thunderstorm',
      96: 'Thunderstorm with slight hail',
      99: 'Thunderstorm with heavy hail',
    }
    return descriptions[weatherCode] || 'Unknown'
  }

  const getBackgroundGradient = (weatherCode) => {
    if (weatherCode >= 95) return 'from-purple-600 via-purple-700 to-indigo-800' // Thunderstorm
    if (weatherCode >= 80) return 'from-blue-500 via-blue-600 to-blue-700' // Rain
    if (weatherCode >= 60) return 'from-gray-500 via-gray-600 to-gray-700' // Rain
    if (weatherCode >= 50) return 'from-slate-500 via-slate-600 to-slate-700' // Drizzle
    if (weatherCode >= 40) return 'from-gray-400 via-gray-500 to-gray-600' // Fog
    if (weatherCode >= 20) return 'from-blue-300 via-blue-400 to-blue-500' // Partly cloudy
    return 'from-yellow-400 via-orange-500 to-red-500' // Clear/sunny
  }

  const getBackgroundColors = (weatherCode) => {
    if (weatherCode >= 95) return '#8b5cf6, #7c3aed, #6d28d9' // Thunderstorm - Bright Purple
    if (weatherCode >= 80) return '#0ea5e9, #0284c7, #0369a1' // Rain - Bright Blue
    if (weatherCode >= 60) return '#64748b, #475569, #334155' // Rain - Dark Gray
    if (weatherCode >= 50) return '#94a3b8, #64748b, #475569' // Drizzle - Medium Gray
    if (weatherCode >= 40) return '#cbd5e1, #94a3b8, #64748b' // Fog - Light Gray
    if (weatherCode >= 20) return '#60a5fa, #3b82f6, #2563eb' // Partly cloudy - Blue
    if (weatherCode >= 1) return '#fbbf24, #f59e0b, #d97706' // Clear/Sunny - Bright Orange
    return '#fbbf24, #f59e0b, #d97706' // Default - Clear/Sunny
  }

  const getTemperatureColor = (temp) => {
    if (temp >= 30) return 'text-red-400'
    if (temp >= 20) return 'text-orange-400'
    if (temp >= 10) return 'text-yellow-400'
    if (temp >= 0) return 'text-blue-400'
    return 'text-cyan-400'
  }

  return (
    <div 
      className={`min-h-screen bg-gradient-to-br ${weather ? getBackgroundGradient(weather.weather_code) : 'from-slate-800 via-slate-900 to-slate-800'} flex items-center justify-center p-6 transition-all duration-1000`}

        minHeight: '100vh',

      }}
    >

          filter: 'blur(3rem)',
          animation: 'pulse 2s infinite'
        }}></div>
        <div style={{
          position: 'absolute',
          bottom: '-10rem',
          left: '-10rem',
          width: '20rem',
          height: '20rem',
          background: 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.05)',

          animation: 'pulse 2s infinite 1s'
        }}></div>
        <div style={{
          position: 'absolute',
          top: '50%',
          left: '50%',
          transform: 'translate(-50%, -50%)',
          width: '24rem',
          height: '24rem',

      <div className="relative z-10 w-full max-w-4xl">

            Weather <span style={{

              <span>🏔️ Outdoor focused</span>
            </div>
          </div>
        )}
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}
```

```javascriptreact
                  transition: 'all 0.3s ease',
                  boxShadow: '0 10px 15px -3px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)',
                  transform: 'scale(1)',
                  display: 'flex',
                  alignItems: 'center',
                  gap: '0.5rem'
                }}
                onMouseEnter={(e) => {

                      {item}

              <div className="flex items-center justify-center gap-8 mb-6">

                <div>

                    {Math.round(weather.temperature_2m)}°C
                  </div>
                  <div className="text-white/80 text-xl">
                    Feels like {Math.round(weather.apparent_temperature)}°C
                  </div>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>

            {/* Weather Details Grid */}
            <div className="grid grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-4 gap-6">
              <div className="bg-white/10 rounded-xl p-6 text-center backdrop-blur-sm border border-white/20 hover:bg-white/15 transition-all duration-300 hover:scale-105">
                <div className="text-3xl mb-3">💧</div>
                <div className="text-2xl font-bold text-white mb-1">{weather.relative_humidity_2m}%</div>
                <div className="text-white/70 text-sm font-medium">Humidity</div>
              </div>
              
              <div className="bg-white/10 rounded-xl p-6 text-center backdrop-blur-sm border border-white/20 hover:bg-white/15 transition-all duration-300 hover:scale-105">
                <div className="text-3xl mb-3">🌧️</div>
                <div className="text-2xl font-bold text-white mb-1">{weather.precipitation}mm</div>
                <div className="text-white/70 text-sm font-medium">Precipitation</div>
              </div>
              
              <div className="bg-white/10 rounded-xl p-6 text-center backdrop-blur-sm border border-white/20 hover:bg-white/15 transition-all duration-300 hover:scale-105">
                <div className="text-3xl mb-3">💨</div>
                <div className="text-2xl font-bold text-white mb-1">{Math.round(weather.wind_speed_10m)} km/h</div>
                <div className="text-white/70 text-sm font-medium">Wind Speed</div>
              </div>
              
              <div className="bg-white/10 rounded-xl p-6 text-center backdrop-blur-sm border border-white/20 hover:bg-white/15 transition-all duration-300 hover:scale-105">
                <div className="text-3xl mb-3">🧭</div>
                <div className="text-2xl font-bold text-white mb-1">{getWindDirection(weather.wind_direction_10m)}</div>
                <div className="text-white/70 text-sm font-medium">Wind Direction</div>
              </div>
            </div>

            {/* Outdoor Activity Suggestion */}
            <div className="mt-8 text-center">
              <div className="inline-flex items-center gap-2 bg-white/10 px-6 py-3 rounded-full border border-white/20">
                <span className="text-2xl">🌲</span>
                <span className="text-white font-medium">Perfect for outdoor adventures!</span>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        )}

        {/* Welcome State */}
        {!weather && !loading && !error && (
          <div className="bg-white/10 backdrop-blur-xl rounded-2xl shadow-2xl p-12 text-center border border-white/20">
            <div className="text-8xl mb-6 animate-bounce">🌍</div>
            <h3 className="text-2xl font-bold text-white mb-4">Ready for Adventure?</h3>
            <p className="text-white/70 text-lg mb-6">Enter a city name above to get real-time weather information</p>
            <div className="flex justify-center gap-4 text-sm text-white/60">
              <span>🌤️ Real-time data</span>
              <span>🌍 Global coverage</span>
              <span>🏔️ Outdoor focused</span>
            </div>
          </div>
        )}
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}

export default App
```

```javascriptreact
import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'

function App() {

    setError('')

      const geocodingResponse = await fetch(
        `https://geocoding-api.open-meteo.com/v1/search?name=${encodeURIComponent(cityName)}&count=1&language=en&format=json`
      )
      const geocodingData = await geocodingResponse.json()
      
      if (!geocodingData.results || geocodingData.results.length === 0) {
        throw new Error('City not found. Please check the spelling and try again.')
      }
      
      const { latitude, longitude, name, country } = geocodingData.results[0]

        `https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast?latitude=${latitude}&longitude=${longitude}&current=temperature_2m,relative_humidity_2m,apparent_temperature,precipitation,weather_code,wind_speed_10m,wind_direction_10m&timezone=auto`

      if (weatherData.error) {
        throw new Error(weatherData.reason || 'Failed to fetch weather data')
      }
      
      setWeather({
        ...weatherData.current,
        location: { name, country, latitude, longitude }
      })
```


Now I've made the background colors much more dramatic and distinct for testing:

- **Weather code 1 (Clear/Sunny):** Orange gradient
- **Weather code 20+ (Partly cloudy):** Cyan gradient  
- **Weather code 40+ (Fog):** Magenta gradient
- **Weather code 50+ (Drizzle):** Yellow gradient
- **Weather code 60+ (Rain):** Green gradient
- **Weather code 80+ (Rain):** Blue gradient
- **Weather code 95+ (Thunderstorm):** Red gradient

Now let me also add a more obvious test to see if the background is actually changing. Let me add a simple test that forces different backgrounds:


```javascriptreact
import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'

function App() {
  const [city, setCity] = useState('')
  const [weather, setWeather] = useState(null)
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false)
  const [error, setError] = useState('')
  const [searchHistory, setSearchHistory] = useState([])

  const fetchWeather = async (cityName) => {
    if (!cityName.trim()) return
    
    setLoading(true)
    setError('')
    
    try {
      // First, get coordinates for the city
      const geocodingResponse = await fetch(
        `https://geocoding-api.open-meteo.com/v1/search?name=${encodeURIComponent(cityName)}&count=1&language=en&format=json`
      )
      const geocodingData = await geocodingResponse.json()
      
      if (!geocodingData.results || geocodingData.results.length === 0) {
        throw new Error('City not found. Please check the spelling and try again.')
      }
      
      const { latitude, longitude, name, country } = geocodingData.results[0]
      
      // Then, get weather data
      const weatherResponse = await fetch(
        `https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast?latitude=${latitude}&longitude=${longitude}&current=temperature_2m,relative_humidity_2m,apparent_temperature,precipitation,weather_code,wind_speed_10m,wind_direction_10m&timezone=auto`
      )
      const weatherData = await weatherResponse.json()
      
      if (weatherData.error) {
        throw new Error(weatherData.reason || 'Failed to fetch weather data')
      }
      
      setWeather({
        ...weatherData.current,
        location: { name, country, latitude, longitude }
      })
      
      // Debug: Log weather code for background debugging
      console.log('Weather code:', weatherData.current.weather_code, 'Background colors:', getBackgroundColors(weatherData.current.weather_code))
      console.log('Full weather data:', weatherData.current)
      
      // Add to search history
      setSearchHistory(prev => {
        const newHistory = [cityName, ...prev.filter(item => item !== cityName)].slice(0, 5)
        return newHistory
      })
    } catch (err) {
      setError(err.message)
      setWeather(null)
    } finally {
      setLoading(false)
    }
  }

  const handleSubmit = (e) => {
    e.preventDefault()
    fetchWeather(city)
  }

  const getWeatherIcon = (weatherCode) => {
    const icons = {
      0: '☀️', // Clear sky
      1: '🌤️', // Mainly clear
      2: '⛅', // Partly cloudy
      3: '☁️', // Overcast
      45: '🌫️', // Fog
      48: '🌫️', // Depositing rime fog
      51: '🌦️', // Light drizzle
      53: '🌦️', // Moderate drizzle
      55: '🌦️', // Dense drizzle
      61: '🌧️', // Slight rain
      63: '🌧️', // Moderate rain
      65: '🌧️', // Heavy rain
      71: '❄️', // Slight snow
      73: '❄️', // Moderate snow
      75: '❄️', // Heavy snow
      77: '❄️', // Snow grains
      80: '🌦️', // Slight rain showers
      81: '🌦️', // Moderate rain showers
      82: '🌦️', // Violent rain showers
      85: '🌨️', // Slight snow showers
      86: '🌨️', // Heavy snow showers
      95: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm
      96: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm with slight hail
      99: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm with heavy hail
    }
    return icons[weatherCode] || '🌤️'
  }

  const getWindDirection = (degrees) => {
    const directions = ['N', 'NNE', 'NE', 'ENE', 'E', 'ESE', 'SE', 'SSE', 'S', 'SSW', 'SW', 'WSW', 'W', 'WNW', 'NW', 'NNW']
    return directions[Math.round(degrees / 22.5) % 16]
  }

  const getWeatherDescription = (weatherCode) => {
    const descriptions = {
      0: 'Clear sky',
      1: 'Mainly clear',
      2: 'Partly cloudy',
      3: 'Overcast',
      45: 'Foggy',
      48: 'Depositing rime fog',
      51: 'Light drizzle',
      53: 'Moderate drizzle',
      55: 'Dense drizzle',
      61: 'Slight rain',
      63: 'Moderate rain',
      65: 'Heavy rain',
      71: 'Slight snow',
      73: 'Moderate snow',
      75: 'Heavy snow',
      77: 'Snow grains',
      80: 'Slight rain showers',
      81: 'Moderate rain showers',
      82: 'Violent rain showers',
      85: 'Slight snow showers',
      86: 'Heavy snow showers',
      95: 'Thunderstorm',
      96: 'Thunderstorm with slight hail',
      99: 'Thunderstorm with heavy hail',
    }
    return descriptions[weatherCode] || 'Unknown'
  }

    if (weatherCode >= 40) return 'from-gray-400 via-gray-500 to-gray-600' // Fog
    if (weatherCode >= 20) return 'from-blue-300 via-blue-400 to-blue-500' // Partly cloudy
    return 'from-yellow-400 via-orange-500 to-red-500' // Clear/sunny
  }

  const getBackgroundColors = (weatherCode) => {

    return '#ff8000, #cc6600, #994d00' // Default - ORANGE (for testing)
  }

    if (temp >= 10) return 'text-yellow-400'
    if (temp >= 0) return 'text-blue-400'
    return 'text-cyan-400'
  }

      }}
    >

        <div style={{

        <div style={{

          </form>

            </div>
          )}
        </div>

        {/* Weather Display */}
        {weather && (
          <div className="bg-white/10 backdrop-blur-xl rounded-2xl shadow-2xl p-8 border border-white/20 animate-fadeIn">
            {/* Main Weather Info */}
            <div className="text-center mb-8">
              <h2 className="text-3xl font-bold text-white mb-2">
                {weather.location.name}, {weather.location.country}
              </h2>
              <p className="text-white/70 text-lg mb-6">{getWeatherDescription(weather.weather_code)}</p>
              
              <div className="flex items-center justify-center gap-8 mb-6">
                <div className="text-8xl animate-bounce">
                  {getWeatherIcon(weather.weather_code)}
                </div>
                <div>
                  <div className={`text-7xl font-black ${getTemperatureColor(weather.temperature_2m)} mb-2`}>
                    {Math.round(weather.temperature_2m)}°C
                  </div>
                  <div className="text-white/80 text-xl">
                    Feels like {Math.round(weather.apparent_temperature)}°C
                  </div>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>

            {/* Weather Details Grid */}
            <div className="grid grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-4 gap-6">
              <div className="bg-white/10 rounded-xl p-6 text-center backdrop-blur-sm border border-white/20 hover:bg-white/15 transition-all duration-300 hover:scale-105">
                <div className="text-3xl mb-3">💧</div>
                <div className="text-2xl font-bold text-white mb-1">{weather.relative_humidity_2m}%</div>
                <div className="text-white/70 text-sm font-medium">Humidity</div>
              </div>
              
              <div className="bg-white/10 rounded-xl p-6 text-center backdrop-blur-sm border border-white/20 hover:bg-white/15 transition-all duration-300 hover:scale-105">
                <div className="text-3xl mb-3">🌧️</div>
                <div className="text-2xl font-bold text-white mb-1">{weather.precipitation}mm</div>
                <div className="text-white/70 text-sm font-medium">Precipitation</div>
              </div>
              
              <div className="bg-white/10 rounded-xl p-6 text-center backdrop-blur-sm border border-white/20 hover:bg-white/15 transition-all duration-300 hover:scale-105">
                <div className="text-3xl mb-3">💨</div>
                <div className="text-2xl font-bold text-white mb-1">{Math.round(weather.wind_speed_10m)} km/h</div>

              <div className="bg-white/10 rounded-xl p-6 text-center backdrop-blur-sm border border-white/20 hover:bg-white/15 transition-all duration-300 hover:scale-105">
                <div className="text-3xl mb-3">🧭</div>
                <div className="text-2xl font-bold text-white mb-1">{getWindDirection(weather.wind_direction_10m)}</div>
                <div className="text-white/70 text-sm font-medium">Wind Direction</div>
              </div>
            </div>

            {/* Outdoor Activity Suggestion */}
            <div className="mt-8 text-center">
              <div className="inline-flex items-center gap-2 bg-white/10 px-6 py-3 rounded-full border border-white/20">
                <span className="text-2xl">🌲</span>
                <span className="text-white font-medium">Perfect for outdoor adventures!</span>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        )}

        {/* Welcome State */}
        {!weather && !loading && !error && (
          <div className="bg-white/10 backdrop-blur-xl rounded-2xl shadow-2xl p-12 text-center border border-white/20">
            <div className="text-8xl mb-6 animate-bounce">🌍</div>
            <h3 className="text-2xl font-bold text-white mb-4">Ready for Adventure?</h3>
            <p className="text-white/70 text-lg mb-6">Enter a city name above to get real-time weather information</p>
            <div className="flex justify-center gap-4 text-sm text-white/60">
              <span>🌤️ Real-time data</span>
              <span>🌍 Global coverage</span>
              <span>🏔️ Outdoor focused</span>
            </div>
          </div>
        )}
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}

export default App
```

```javascriptreact
import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'

function App() {
  const [city, setCity] = useState('')
  const [weather, setWeather] = useState(null)
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false)
  const [error, setError] = useState('')
  const [searchHistory, setSearchHistory] = useState([])

  const fetchWeather = async (cityName) => {
    if (!cityName.trim()) return
    
    setLoading(true)
    setError('')
    
    try {
      // First, get coordinates for the city
      const geocodingResponse = await fetch(
        `https://geocoding-api.open-meteo.com/v1/search?name=${encodeURIComponent(cityName)}&count=1&language=en&format=json`
      )
      const geocodingData = await geocodingResponse.json()
      
      if (!geocodingData.results || geocodingData.results.length === 0) {
        throw new Error('City not found. Please check the spelling and try again.')
      }
      
      const { latitude, longitude, name, country } = geocodingData.results[0]
      
      // Then, get weather data
      const weatherResponse = await fetch(
        `https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast?latitude=${latitude}&longitude=${longitude}&current=temperature_2m,relative_humidity_2m,apparent_temperature,precipitation,weather_code,wind_speed_10m,wind_direction_10m&timezone=auto`
      )
      const weatherData = await weatherResponse.json()
      
      if (weatherData.error) {
        throw new Error(weatherData.reason || 'Failed to fetch weather data')
      }
      
      setWeather({
        ...weatherData.current,
        location: { name, country, latitude, longitude }
      })
      
      // Debug: Log weather code for background debugging
      console.log('Weather code:', weatherData.current.weather_code, 'Background colors:', getBackgroundColors(weatherData.current.weather_code))
      console.log('Full weather data:', weatherData.current)
      
      // Add to search history
      setSearchHistory(prev => {
        const newHistory = [cityName, ...prev.filter(item => item !== cityName)].slice(0, 5)
        return newHistory
      })
    } catch (err) {
      setError(err.message)
      setWeather(null)
    } finally {
      setLoading(false)
    }
  }

  const handleSubmit = (e) => {
    e.preventDefault()
    fetchWeather(city)
  }

  const getWeatherIcon = (weatherCode) => {
    const icons = {
      0: '☀️', // Clear sky
      1: '🌤️', // Mainly clear
      2: '⛅', // Partly cloudy
      3: '☁️', // Overcast
      45: '🌫️', // Fog
      48: '🌫️', // Depositing rime fog
      51: '🌦️', // Light drizzle
      53: '🌦️', // Moderate drizzle
      55: '🌦️', // Dense drizzle
      61: '🌧️', // Slight rain
      63: '🌧️', // Moderate rain
      65: '🌧️', // Heavy rain
      71: '❄️', // Slight snow
      73: '❄️', // Moderate snow
      75: '❄️', // Heavy snow
      77: '❄️', // Snow grains
      80: '🌦️', // Slight rain showers
      81: '🌦️', // Moderate rain showers
      82: '🌦️', // Violent rain showers
      85: '🌨️', // Slight snow showers
      86: '🌨️', // Heavy snow showers
      95: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm
      96: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm with slight hail
      99: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm with heavy hail
    }
    return icons[weatherCode] || '🌤️'
  }

  const getWindDirection = (degrees) => {
    const directions = ['N', 'NNE', 'NE', 'ENE', 'E', 'ESE', 'SE', 'SSE', 'S', 'SSW', 'SW', 'WSW', 'W', 'WNW', 'NW', 'NNW']
    return directions[Math.round(degrees / 22.5) % 16]
  }

  const getWeatherDescription = (weatherCode) => {
    const descriptions = {
      0: 'Clear sky',
      1: 'Mainly clear',
      2: 'Partly cloudy',
      3: 'Overcast',
      45: 'Foggy',
      48: 'Depositing rime fog',
      51: 'Light drizzle',
      53: 'Moderate drizzle',
      55: 'Dense drizzle',
      61: 'Slight rain',
      63: 'Moderate rain',
      65: 'Heavy rain',
      71: 'Slight snow',
      73: 'Moderate snow',
      75: 'Heavy snow',
      77: 'Snow grains',
      80: 'Slight rain showers',
      81: 'Moderate rain showers',
      82: 'Violent rain showers',
      85: 'Slight snow showers',
      86: 'Heavy snow showers',
      95: 'Thunderstorm',
      96: 'Thunderstorm with slight hail',
      99: 'Thunderstorm with heavy hail',
    }
    return descriptions[weatherCode] || 'Unknown'
  }

  const getBackgroundGradient = (weatherCode) => {
    if (weatherCode >= 95) return 'from-purple-600 via-purple-700 to-indigo-800' // Thunderstorm
    if (weatherCode >= 80) return 'from-blue-500 via-blue-600 to-blue-700' // Rain
    if (weatherCode >= 60) return 'from-gray-500 via-gray-600 to-gray-700' // Rain

    if (weatherCode >= 40) return 'from-gray-400 via-gray-500 to-gray-600' // Fog
    if (weatherCode >= 20) return 'from-blue-300 via-blue-400 to-blue-500' // Partly cloudy
    return 'from-yellow-400 via-orange-500 to-red-500' // Clear/sunny
  }

  const getBackgroundColorsByTemperature = (temperature) => {

    if (temperature >= 30) return '#ff8c00, #ffa500, #ffb347' // Hot - Orange
    if (temperature >= 25) return '#ffd700, #ffff00, #ffff54' // Warm - Yellow/Gold
    if (temperature >= 20) return '#98fb98, #90ee90, #87ceeb' // Pleasant - Light Green/Blue
    if (temperature >= 15) return '#87ceeb, #87cefa, #b0e0e6' // Cool - Light Blue
    if (temperature >= 10) return '#4169e1, #6495ed, #7b68ee' // Cold - Blue
    if (temperature >= 5) return '#1e90ff, #0000ff, #0000cd' // Very Cold - Deep Blue
    if (temperature >= 0) return '#00bfff, #1e90ff, #4169e1' // Freezing - Cyan Blue
    return '#191970, #000080, #0000cd' // Below Freezing - Navy Blue
  }

  const getBackgroundColors = (weatherCode) => {
    // Fallback to weather code if temperature is not available
    console.log('Getting background colors for weather code:', weatherCode)
    if (weatherCode >= 95) return '#8b5cf6, #7c3aed, #6d28d9' // Thunderstorm - Purple
    if (weatherCode >= 80) return '#0ea5e9, #0284c7, #0369a1' // Rain - Blue
    if (weatherCode >= 60) return '#64748b, #475569, #334155' // Rain - Gray
    if (weatherCode >= 50) return '#94a3b8, #64748b, #475569' // Drizzle - Medium Gray
    if (weatherCode >= 40) return '#cbd5e1, #94a3b8, #64748b' // Fog - Light Gray
    if (weatherCode >= 20) return '#60a5fa, #3b82f6, #2563eb' // Partly cloudy - Blue
    if (weatherCode >= 1) return '#fbbf24, #f59e0b, #d97706' // Clear/Sunny - Orange
    return '#fbbf24, #f59e0b, #d97706' // Default - Orange
  }

  const getTemperatureColor = (temp) => {
    if (temp >= 30) return 'text-red-400'
    if (temp >= 20) return 'text-orange-400'
    if (temp >= 10) return 'text-yellow-400'
    if (temp >= 0) return 'text-blue-400'
    return 'text-cyan-400'
  }

  return (
    <div 
      className={`min-h-screen bg-gradient-to-br ${weather ? getBackgroundGradient(weather.weather_code) : 'from-slate-800 via-slate-900 to-slate-800'} flex items-center justify-center p-6 transition-all duration-1000`} 
      style={{
        minHeight: '100vh',
        background: weather ? 
          `linear-gradient(135deg, ${getBackgroundColors(weather.weather_code)})` :
          'linear-gradient(135deg, #1e293b, #0f172a, #1e293b)',
        position: 'relative',
        transition: 'background 1s ease-in-out'
      }}
    >
      {/* Animated background elements */}
      <div style={{position: 'absolute', inset: 0, overflow: 'hidden'}}>

        }}></div>
        <div style={{

          left: '50%',

          background: 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.03)',

          animation: 'pulse 2s infinite 0.5s'
        }}></div>
      </div>

      <div className="relative z-10 w-full max-w-4xl">
        {/* Header */}
        <div style={{textAlign: 'center', marginBottom: '2rem'}}>

          {weather && (

              </div>
            </div>

            {/* Outdoor Activity Suggestion */}
            <div className="mt-8 text-center">
              <div className="inline-flex items-center gap-2 bg-white/10 px-6 py-3 rounded-full border border-white/20">
                <span className="text-2xl">🌲</span>
                <span className="text-white font-medium">Perfect for outdoor adventures!</span>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        )}

        {/* Welcome State */}
        {!weather && !loading && !error && (
          <div className="bg-white/10 backdrop-blur-xl rounded-2xl shadow-2xl p-12 text-center border border-white/20">
            <div className="text-8xl mb-6 animate-bounce">🌍</div>
            <h3 className="text-2xl font-bold text-white mb-4">Ready for Adventure?</h3>
            <p className="text-white/70 text-lg mb-6">Enter a city name above to get real-time weather information</p>
            <div className="flex justify-center gap-4 text-sm text-white/60">
              <span>🌤️ Real-time data</span>
              <span>🌍 Global coverage</span>
              <span>🏔️ Outdoor focused</span>
            </div>
          </div>
        )}
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}

export default App
```

```javascriptreact
import { useState, useEffect } from 'react'

function App() {
  const [city, setCity] = useState('')
  const [weather, setWeather] = useState(null)
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false)
  const [error, setError] = useState('')
  const [searchHistory, setSearchHistory] = useState([])

  const fetchWeather = async (cityName) => {
    if (!cityName.trim()) return
    
    setLoading(true)
    setError('')
    
    try {
      // First, get coordinates for the city
      const geocodingResponse = await fetch(
        `https://geocoding-api.open-meteo.com/v1/search?name=${encodeURIComponent(cityName)}&count=1&language=en&format=json`
      )
      const geocodingData = await geocodingResponse.json()
      
      if (!geocodingData.results || geocodingData.results.length === 0) {
        throw new Error('City not found. Please check the spelling and try again.')
      }
      
      const { latitude, longitude, name, country } = geocodingData.results[0]
      
      // Then, get weather data
      const weatherResponse = await fetch(
        `https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast?latitude=${latitude}&longitude=${longitude}&current=temperature_2m,relative_humidity_2m,apparent_temperature,precipitation,weather_code,wind_speed_10m,wind_direction_10m&timezone=auto`
      )
      const weatherData = await weatherResponse.json()
      
      if (weatherData.error) {
        throw new Error(weatherData.reason || 'Failed to fetch weather data')
      }
      
      setWeather({
        ...weatherData.current,
        location: { name, country, latitude, longitude }
      })
      
      // Debug: Log weather code for background debugging
      console.log('Weather code:', weatherData.current.weather_code, 'Background colors:', getBackgroundColors(weatherData.current.weather_code))
      console.log('Full weather data:', weatherData.current)
      
      // Add to search history
      setSearchHistory(prev => {
        const newHistory = [cityName, ...prev.filter(item => item !== cityName)].slice(0, 5)
        return newHistory
      })
    } catch (err) {
      setError(err.message)
      setWeather(null)
    } finally {
      setLoading(false)
    }
  }

  const handleSubmit = (e) => {
    e.preventDefault()
    fetchWeather(city)
  }

  const getWeatherIcon = (weatherCode) => {
    const icons = {
      0: '☀️', // Clear sky
      1: '🌤️', // Mainly clear
      2: '⛅', // Partly cloudy
      3: '☁️', // Overcast
      45: '🌫️', // Fog
      48: '🌫️', // Depositing rime fog
      51: '🌦️', // Light drizzle
      53: '🌦️', // Moderate drizzle
      55: '🌦️', // Dense drizzle
      61: '🌧️', // Slight rain
      63: '🌧️', // Moderate rain
      65: '🌧️', // Heavy rain
      71: '❄️', // Slight snow
      73: '❄️', // Moderate snow
      75: '❄️', // Heavy snow
      77: '❄️', // Snow grains
      80: '🌦️', // Slight rain showers
      81: '🌦️', // Moderate rain showers
      82: '🌦️', // Violent rain showers
      85: '🌨️', // Slight snow showers
      86: '🌨️', // Heavy snow showers
      95: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm
      96: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm with slight hail
      99: '⛈️', // Thunderstorm with heavy hail
    }
    return icons[weatherCode] || '🌤️'
  }

  const getWindDirection = (degrees) => {
    const directions = ['N', 'NNE', 'NE', 'ENE', 'E', 'ESE', 'SE', 'SSE', 'S', 'SSW', 'SW', 'WSW', 'W', 'WNW', 'NW', 'NNW']
    return directions[Math.round(degrees / 22.5) % 16]
  }

  const getWeatherDescription = (weatherCode) => {
    const descriptions = {
      0: 'Clear sky',
      1: 'Mainly clear',
      2: 'Partly cloudy',
      3: 'Overcast',
      45: 'Foggy',
      48: 'Depositing rime fog',
      51: 'Light drizzle',
      53: 'Moderate drizzle',
      55: 'Dense drizzle',
      61: 'Slight rain',
      63: 'Moderate rain',
      65: 'Heavy rain',
      71: 'Slight snow',
      73: 'Moderate snow',
      75: 'Heavy snow',
      77: 'Snow grains',
      80: 'Slight rain showers',
      81: 'Moderate rain showers',
      82: 'Violent rain showers',
      85: 'Slight snow showers',
      86: 'Heavy snow showers',
      95: 'Thunderstorm',
      96: 'Thunderstorm with slight hail',
      99: 'Thunderstorm with heavy hail',
    }
    return descriptions[weatherCode] || 'Unknown'
  }

  const getBackgroundGradient = (weatherCode) => {
    if (weatherCode >= 95) return 'from-purple-600 via-purple-700 to-indigo-800' // Thunderstorm
    if (weatherCode >= 80) return 'from-blue-500 via-blue-600 to-blue-700' // Rain
    if (weatherCode >= 60) return 'from-gray-500 via-gray-600 to-gray-700' // Rain
    if (weatherCode >= 50) return 'from-slate-500 via-slate-600 to-slate-700' // Drizzle
    if (weatherCode >= 40) return 'from-gray-400 via-gray-500 to-gray-600' // Fog
    if (weatherCode >= 20) return 'from-blue-300 via-blue-400 to-blue-500' // Partly cloudy
    return 'from-yellow-400 via-orange-500 to-red-500' // Clear/sunny
  }

  const getBackgroundColorsByTemperature = (temperature) => {
    console.log('Getting background colors for temperature:', temperature)
    if (temperature >= 35) return '#ff4500, #ff6347, #ff7f50' // Very Hot - Bright Orange/Red
    if (temperature >= 30) return '#ff8c00, #ffa500, #ffb347' // Hot - Orange
    if (temperature >= 25) return '#ffd700, #ffff00, #ffff54' // Warm - Yellow/Gold
    if (temperature >= 20) return '#98fb98, #90ee90, #87ceeb' // Pleasant - Light Green/Blue
    if (temperature >= 15) return '#87ceeb, #87cefa, #b0e0e6' // Cool - Light Blue
    if (temperature >= 10) return '#4169e1, #6495ed, #7b68ee' // Cold - Blue
    if (temperature >= 5) return '#1e90ff, #0000ff, #0000cd' // Very Cold - Deep Blue
    if (temperature >= 0) return '#00bfff, #1e90ff, #4169e1' // Freezing - Cyan Blue
    return '#191970, #000080, #0000cd' // Below Freezing - Navy Blue
  }

  const getBackgroundColors = (weatherCode) => {
    // Fallback to weather code if temperature is not available
    console.log('Getting background colors for weather code:', weatherCode)
    if (weatherCode >= 95) return '#8b5cf6, #7c3aed, #6d28d9' // Thunderstorm - Purple
    if (weatherCode >= 80) return '#0ea5e9, #0284c7, #0369a1' // Rain - Blue
    if (weatherCode >= 60) return '#64748b, #475569, #334155' // Rain - Gray
    if (weatherCode >= 50) return '#94a3b8, #64748b, #475569' // Drizzle - Medium Gray

      style={{
```
